subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Another prototype diode device for EVP capture
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
Interesting approach. In the video demo at about 4:31 into the video it sounds like "look Mike hello" said twice. And it sounded like something about light in there too but wasnt clear enough for me to be sure.

A couple others here were using diodes to record with instead of microphones but theres sounded alot different. Not sure how they set those up. You know me I always go for the easy to do stuff hehehe but I believe Frank Ratka tried using diodes and hmm maybe retro Dave did once? You'd have to ask them. 

Misty


--- On Fri, 11/21/08, M.A. Coletta (Mike) <michaelcoletta@...> wrote:

> From: M.A. Coletta (Mike) <michaelcoletta@...>
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Another prototype diode device for EVP capture
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Friday, November 21, 2008, 5:36 PM
> Greetings fellow researchers,
> 
> Well... I've completed another prototype diode device
> for EVP capture.  
> This one I put in a clear case so you can see the circuit. 
> It is 
> similar to the first one I designed (Device #1) and built,
> except this 
> one (Device #2) uses a slightly different coil with ferrite
> core and 
> different diodes. Their breakdown voltage is less than the
> first I used.
> 
> You can see pictures of it here:
> http://www.ufogeek.com/mikes_diode_evp_device.htm
> 
> It's on the webpage, below Device #1.
> 
> The audio from my first test is here:
> http://www.ufogeek.com/sessions/diodeplasma2.WMA
> 
> Thanks,
> - Mike C. (UFO Geek)
